results.title: Seven years in Tibet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Iain Smith, John H. Williams, Applecross Productions and Reperage and Vanguard Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Austrian climber Heinrich Harrer, this is the amazing true story of his friendship with the Dalai Lama. Climbing in the Himalayas, Harrer is captured as a POW in China at the start of the second world war. He manages to escape the camp and flees across the mountains into isolated Tibet. As one of the few foreigners to ever enter Tibet, Harrer forms a friendship with the young Dalai Lama and becomes his confidante. The film depicts the most tumultuous period of Tibetan history in which China invades and occupies Tibet - an oppression which continues to this day.

results.title: Up close & personal (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner, David Nicksay and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings, Sally Atwater (Michelle Pfeiffer) is about to hit the big time. Arriving from a trailer park in Nevada, an overeager and overdressed weather girl, she makes a disastrous debut on national television. All is not lost however as her passion for the job captures the eye of the experienced, and handsome newsman, Warren Justice (Robert Redford). With Warren’s help Sally is transformed, Pygmalian style, into a popular and respected journalist. Along the way romance develops, but this is threatened by Sally’s newfound success and they must find a balance between love and their successful careers. Cast includes Stockard Channing, Joe Mantegna and Kate Nelligan.

results.title: The Shawshank redemption (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Frank Darabont, Niki Marvin and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: An unforgettable story of hope, friendship and survival inside a maximum security gaol. Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a New England banker convicted of murdering his wife and her lover, is sent to Shawshank State Prison where he meets “Red” Redding (Morgan Freeman), a seasoned lifer. Despite twenty years on the inside, the prison bars fail to contain their spirits and the pair forge an unlikely friendship that overcomes pain, suffering and ultimately leads to a chance at freedom.

results.title: Broadcast news (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James L. Brooks, James L. Brooks Films, Gracie Films and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Three ambitious workaholics are set loose in a network TV newsroom where their professional and personal lives become hopelessly cross wired. Writer-director James L. Brooks is a filmmaker who is able to brilliantly combine comedy and drama with rich characters and unforgettable dialogue. His satire on the media can also be seen on ‘The Simpsons’ for which he is Executive Producer. He paints a savage, knowing, hilarious look at the television news industry and also what can happen to your personal life when your job consumes you. The performances are simply phenomenal. William Hurt gives depth to a dimbulb anchor, but Holly Hunter and Albert Brooks walk away with the movie. Cast includes Jack Nicholson (unbilled) and Joan Cusack. Music by Bill Conti.

results.title: Paradise road (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Sue Milliken, Greg Coote, Samson Productions and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on actual events, this is the story of a group of Australian, British and Dutch women who, after the fall of Singapore in 1942, were held captive by the Japanese on the island of Sumatra. Herded into a brutal prisoner of war camp, the women soon discovered only the fittest, the strongest and the bravest could possibly survive such inhumane conditions. Stripped of everything they had, their irrepressible courage led them to find one voice, a vocal orchestra, singing music written for piano or orchestra. A voice that ultimately expressed their indomitable, unbreakable spirit. Cast includes Glenn Close, Pauline Collins, Frances McDormand, Cate Blanchett, Wendy Hughes, Pamela Rabe and Julianna Margulies.

results.title: Pretty in pink
results.creator_credit: Howard Deutch, Lauren Shuler and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Andie (Molly Ringwald) is a girl of modest means, who may have to suffer the humiliation of having no date for the prom. She just wants to express herself through her eccentric fashion sense, but this does not sit well with her peers at the snob-ridden local high school. Pretty in Pink’ is a classic80s “teen flick”, which, to quote Adrian Martin, “sensitizes us to all that is modest, fleeting, fragile in popular cinema and popular culture”. Cast includes Molly Ringwald, Andrew McCarthy and Jon Cryer.

results.title: Sex and Zen II
results.creator_credit: Chin Man-Kei, Wong Jing and Golden Movies International
results.brief_description: A surreal, offbeat and lush sequel to the original cult classic, this is the farcical story of a man whose lascivious escapades lead to serious trouble. In the process of arranging a liason for his son, the hero becomes involved with the ‘Mirage Woman’, unaware that she is a pursued criminal who extracts the essence of all her sexual partners and kills them. With four wives and the pick of all the women in the country, has he finally met his match? This is a humourous and colourful saga that continues the notoriously explicit style of the original. In Cantonese with english subtitles.

results.title: The King of comedy
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Arnon Milchan and Embassy International Pictures
results.brief_description: Rupert Pupkin (Robert De Niro), is an aspiring comedian obsessed with TV talk show host, Jerry Langford (Jerry Lewis). After co-ordinating a meeting with his idol, Rupert tells Langford about the comedy material he has written. Langford is as charming as he is dismissive, and after being repeatedly rejected and eventually ejected by Langford’s staff, Rupert decides to take matters into his own hands, conspiring a sensationally irresponsible scheme to beat defeat. The ‘King of Comedy’ is widely seen as Martin Scorsese’s cynically black-comic reaction to the media firestorm that followed his 1976 film ‘Taxi Driver’.

results.title: Blackrock
results.creator_credit: Steven Vidler, David Elfick, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: The badly beaten, gang-raped corpse of a 15 year old girl is discovered on a deserted stretch of beach after an all-night beach party, celebrating the return of local surfing legend, Ricko, goes out of control. The working class Australian coastal community of Blackrock goes into an uproar, and is promptly splintered by shame, deceit and mistrust. 17 year old Jared (who organised Ricko’s party at the local surf club), is left with the wrenching decision whether or not to rat on his mates. Cast includes Laurence Breuls, Linda Cropper, Simon Lyndon, Chris Haywood, Rebecca Smart, Essie Davis and Jessica Napier.

results.title: The Well
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Sandra Levy, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.
